ProgramName: Master of Science in Applied Data Science
EnglishScore: International applicants must submit TOEFL or IELTS scores.
Requirements: A completed online application. A $50 application fee (waived for Clarkson alumni). A statement of purpose. A resume. Three letters of recommendation. Official transcripts. Standardized test scores (optional).
Description: Data is everywhere. So are data scientists. The U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics projects a 35 percent growth in data science jobs over the next decade. The Master of Science in Applied Data Science program at Clarkson University can help you launch or advance your career in this rapidly growing field. In this program, you will develop a deep understanding of the analytical and computational tools used to extract insights from large datasets. Through our flexible curriculum, you can tailor your studies to your interests and career goals. You'll work with faculty who are leaders in their fields, gain hands-on experience through project-based courses and research, and be prepared to take on data challenges in a variety of industries, from finance and healthcare to technology and engineering.

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Bioethics
EnglishScore: For international applicants whose native language is not English, an English Proficiency Test Score is required. Clarkson accepts TOEFL (minimum 80 internet-based), IELTS (minimum 6.5), Duolingo English Test (minimum 115), and Pearson PTE academic test (minimum 56).
Concentration: Clinical Ethics, Research Ethics, Global Health Ethics
Description: The Clarkson University Bioethics Program, a partnership with the Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai, is a flexible course of study that provides students with a strong foundation in the history, philosophy, legal, social, and cultural contexts of bioethics. Students have the opportunity to focus their study with a concentration in either clinical ethics, research ethics, or global health ethics.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Bioscience and Biotechnology, Interdisciplinary
EnglishScore: International students are required to take the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) or the International English Language Testing System (IELTS). A minimum TOEFL score of 80 (Internet-based) or a minimum IELTS score of 6.5 is required. Students who have completed all of their primary and secondary education, and their undergraduate degree, in an English-speaking country are exempt from the English language proficiency requirement. We also accept PTE with a minimum score of 56 and Duolingo with a minimum score of 115.
Requirements:
To apply, you will need to submit the following:

An online application.
A current resume.
A statement of purpose.
Three letters of recommendation.
Transcripts from all colleges and universities attended.
GRE General Test: Not required.
Description: The interdisciplinary Master of Science (M.S.) in Bioscience and Biotechnology program at Clarkson University provides a broad foundation in basic science and biotechnology while focusing on a particular specialty area. You'll gain advanced skills and knowledge through a mix of coursework and intensive, hands-on research in faculty laboratories. Graduate with real-world experience and preparation for your career. Our program is perfect for students who are looking for: Research-focused careers in academia or industry. Professional careers in medicine, veterinary medicine and other health-related fields. Through our program, you will develop skills in: Modern research methods. Experimental design. Data analysis and interpretation. Oral and written communication. Our alumni have a track record of success in Ph.D. programs, medical schools and other health profession schools, as well as in the biotechnology, biopharmaceutical and environmental industries. The MS in bioscience and biotechnology is also available as a BS/MS program for current Clarkson undergraduates.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Business of Energy
Department: David D. Reh School of Business
Description: The M.S. in Business of Energy is an interdisciplinary program jointly offered by Clarkson's Reh School of Business and the Institute for a Sustainable Environment (ISE). The program is focused on the management and business aspects of the energy sector, including energy markets, policy, economics and finance, and prepares students for a variety of leadership roles. The curriculum is designed to provide students with a strong foundation in business fundamentals as well as specialized knowledge in energy-related topics. Graduates of the program will be well-equipped to pursue careers in a variety of industries, including energy companies, utilities, consulting firms, financial institutions and government agencies. Key areas of study in the M.S. in Business of Energy program include energy markets, energy economics, energy finance, energy analytics, energy law and policy, energy operations, and energy entrepreneurship and innovation. The curriculum is designed to be flexible, allowing students to tailor their coursework to their specific interests and career goals. Students will have the opportunity to work on real-world projects and case studies, gaining hands-on experience in the energy industry. The program will also host a speaker series, providing students with the chance to learn from and network with industry leaders. The Reh School of Business also offers an online MBA with a concentration in the business of energy and a graduate certificate in the business of energy. This program is STEM-designated.

ProgramName: Master of Business Administration
EnglishScore: All international applicants whose native language is not English must submit scores from the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), Pearson Test of English (PTE) or Duolingo English Test. The minimum acceptable score on the TOEFL is 80 (Internet-based). The minimum acceptable score on the IELTS is 6.5. The minimum acceptable score on the PTE is 56. The minimum acceptable score on the Duolingo is 115. The English proficiency test requirement is waived for applicants who have completed a degree at an institution where English is the language of instruction.
Concentration: ['Business Analytics', 'Environmental Management', 'Finance', 'Global Supply Chain Management', 'Healthcare Management', 'Innovation and New Venture Management', 'Marketing', 'Management Information Systems']
Description: Our Master of Business Administration (MBA) is an internationally-recognized degree designed to develop the skills required for careers in business and management. The David D. Reh School of Business is among the top 5 percent of business schools in the world to have earned the prestigious AACSB-International accreditation. Clarkson’s MBA program has been recognized in several prominent national rankings. U.S. News & World Report ranked our MBA program in the top 100 in the nation. This 38-credit hour program will provide you with strong ethical decision-making principles and expertise in a STEM-focused and globally-minded business world. As a result, you will emerge with an edge in today’s demanding and dynamic marketplace. All MBA candidates at Clarkson take a required core curriculum, with courses in areas such as financial and managerial accounting, operations and supply chain management and information systems. After completing your required core courses, you will be able to pursue a variety of different concentrations. This allows you to combine your management knowledge with your industry-specific interests to create a more direct path to your career goals.
Accredidation: The David D. Reh School of Business is among the top 5 percent of business schools in the world to have earned the prestigious AACSB-International accreditation.

ProgramName: Master of Business Administration, Online
EnglishScore: International applicants whose native language is not English must provide proof of English proficiency. Accepted tests and minimum scores are: TOEFL (80 iBT / 550 PBT), IELTS (6.5), PTE Academic (56), Duolingo (115), or successful completion of ELS Language Centers Level 112.
Concentration: ['Business Analytics', 'Environmental Management', 'Global Supply Chain Management', 'Healthcare Management', 'Leadership', 'Marketing', 'Project Management', 'Quality Management', 'No Concentration - General']
Description: The Clarkson University Online Master of Business Administration (MBA) is an innovative program that transforms students into business leaders. The Clarkson MBA is ranked among the top 100 in the nation by U.S. News & World Report. Our flexible program allows you to set your own pace to completion. You can take one to five courses per semester, creating a work-life balance that suits you. The program offers a leadership development component unique to Clarkson. As an online student, you are a full member of the Clarkson community and have access to career services and a network of over 40,000 alumni. Clarkson's online MBA is an exceptional program by every measure.
Accredidation: The Clarkson University Reh School of Business is accredited by the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB). Fewer than five percent of business schools worldwide have this distinction.

ProgramName: Master of Business Administration in Business Analytics
EnglishScore: If your native language is not English, you must submit official results of the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), Pearson Test of English (PTE) or Duolingo English Test.
Department: David D. Reh School of Business
Description: This program will prepare students to collect, process, and analyze data to make well-informed business decisions. Data analytics jobs are booming as the amount of data generated by businesses continues to grow. Clarkson's MBA in Business Analytics is designed to give students a comprehensive understanding of business and the skills to succeed in this growing field.
Accredidation: The David D. Reh School of Business is accredited by the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB).

ProgramName: Master of Science in Chemical Engineering
EnglishScore: Students for whom English is not their native language must submit scores from the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), the International English Language Testing System (IELTS), or the Duolingo English Test. Minimum scores are TOEFL: 80 iBT, IELTS: 6.5, Duolingo: 115.
Requirements: In addition to the general application requirements, the following are required for this program: A statement of purpose is required. A resume is required. Three letters of recommendation are required. The GRE is not required. Prerequisite coursework should include differential equations and courses in transport phenomena, thermodynamics and reaction kinetics.
Department: Wallace H. Coulter School of Engineering
Description: The graduate program in chemical engineering at Clarkson University provides students with a targeted, advanced education in the principles of chemical engineering. As a student in our program, you will expand on your undergraduate education by taking core chemical engineering classes. You can choose to concentrate your elective coursework and research in four main areas: Advanced Materials, Biotechnology, Energy and the Environment, and Complex Fluids. Graduates of this program are prepared to enter a Ph.D. program or for careers in a wide range of fields, including chemical engineering, industrial and engineering chemistry, materials science, polymers, pharmaceuticals and more.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Chemistry
DeadlineDate: January 15 (priority deadline for funding for Fall admission); October 15 (priority deadline for funding for Spring admission)
EnglishScore: All international applicants whose native language is not English are required to submit proof of English language proficiency. We accept the following tests: TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language): Minimum score of 80 on the iBT (internet-based test) or 550 on the PBT (paper-based test). IELTS (International English Language Testing System): Minimum score of 6.5. PTE (Pearson Test of English): Minimum score of 56. Duolingo English Test: Minimum score of 115.
Description: Our graduate program in chemistry offers both MS and PhD degrees. You will learn to perform cutting-edge research in a wide variety of areas, including analytical, inorganic, organic and physical chemistry. You can also explore interdisciplinary areas like materials science, environmental science and engineering, and biomolecular science. Coursework and research are tailored to your interests. Our master's program can be completed in two years or less. It culminates with a final written thesis, which is defended in an oral presentation to a committee of faculty.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Civil and Environmental Engineering
EnglishScore: If your native language is not English, you must submit TOEFL or IELTS scores.
Department: Wallace H. Coulter School of Engineering
Concentration: ['Structural and Geotechnical Engineering Focus Area', 'Environmental and Water Resources Engineering Focus Area', 'Construction Engineering Management Focus Area']
Description: The Master of Science (MS) in Civil & Environmental Engineering is a 30-credit-hour program that deepens your understanding of the design and management of civil infrastructure and the environment. You can complete the degree entirely on campus, entirely online or through a combination of on-campus and online course offerings. A thesis is optional. Civil and environmental engineering is a broad field with many career opportunities. This degree prepares students to be leaders in consulting, industry and government agencies. Our faculty's areas of expertise and active research include: Water resources, Environmental engineering, Geotechnical engineering, Structural engineering. The curriculum is flexible to accommodate your interests. You'll work with your academic advisor to create a study plan with a set of courses to best meet your educational goals.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Clinical Leadership in Healthcare Management
EnglishScore: All international students are required to demonstrate English proficiency. You can do this by submitting one of the following: TOEFL: 80 minimum on the iBT (or 550 on the paper-based exam); IELTS: 6.5 minimum overall band score; PTE: 56 minimum; Duolingo English Test: 115 minimum; ELS Language Center: successful completion of Level 112.
Requirements: To be considered for admission, applicants should have a bachelor's degree from a regionally accredited college or university. In addition to general graduate admission requirements, students must also have two years of relevant healthcare experience to be considered.
Description: Clarkson University’s Master of Science degree in Clinical Leadership in Healthcare Management is a graduate program designed to meet the needs of working healthcare professionals. Our 36-credit-hour curriculum blends courses from our nationally-ranked healthcare management MBA program with specialized courses in clinical leadership. The program features a unique combination of online and in-person instruction that is ideal for professionals who seek to improve their clinical leadership and management skills, but cannot commit to a traditional, full-time graduate program. This program is offered in partnership with the an institutional member of the New York-Presbyterian Healthcare System, located at a major hospital system in the lower Hudson Valley, N.Y.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Computer Science
EnglishScore: International applicants must submit proof of English proficiency. Accepted exams include TOEFL (iBT) with a minimum score of 80, IELTS with a minimum of 6.5, PTE with a minimum of 56, Duolingo with a minimum of 115, or graduation from ELS Level 112.
Requirements: A completed online application. A bachelor's degree (or equivalent) in computer science, computer engineering or a related field from an accredited college or university. An undergraduate GPA of at least 3.0 out of 4.0 is required. Transcripts from all colleges and universities attended. A résumé or curriculum vitae. A statement of purpose. Three letters of recommendation. GRE General Test Scores: The GRE is waived for MS applicants with a GPA of 3.0 or higher. TOEFL, IELTS, or Duolingo scores are required for all students who have not completed a degree in a country where English is the native language.
Description:
The Master of Science (MS) in Computer Science degree provides a path to a more advanced understanding of computer science for recent graduates, or for professionals who are already in the workforce and wish to enhance their knowledge and skills. It also provides an excellent foundation for those who plan to pursue a PhD.

The MS in Computer Science is a 30-credit hour program that can be completed in about 1.5 years on average. You will explore a variety of concepts in classes like Programming Languages, Artificial Intelligence and Algorithms & Data Structures. Clarkson also has numerous opportunities for research, from robotics to bioinformatics to virtual reality. The flexible curriculum and choice between a thesis or non-thesis track allow you to build a program that caters to your unique interests and goals.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Construction Engineering Management
EnglishScore: TOEFL, IELTS, PTE, or Duolingo English Test scores are required if your native language is not English. We require a minimum TOEFL score of 80 IBT, IELTS score of 6.5, PTE score of 56 or Duolingo English Test of 115. Successful completion of ELS Language Centers level 112 is also acceptable.
Requirements: The following application materials are required: a completed online application, statement of purpose, resume or curriculum vitae, two letters of recommendation, and official transcripts from all institutions attended. Clarkson does not require the GRE/GMAT for admission into our graduate programs.
Department: Wallace H. Coulter School of Engineering
Description: Our Master of Science in Construction Engineering Management (MS-CEM) is designed for students with an undergraduate degree in an engineering discipline who want to pursue a career in the construction industry. The program will provide you with the business, management and technical skills needed to be a leader in the construction engineering and management field. As a student in this program, you will develop a personalized plan of study to meet your own career goals in consultation with a faculty advisor. The MS-CEM is a 30-credit, non-thesis program that can be completed in as little as one calendar year. This degree can also be pursued on a part-time basis. It is available to both on-campus and online students.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Electrical and Computer Engineering
EnglishScore: All international applicants must prove English proficiency by meeting the minimum requirements of one of the following tests: TOEFL (iBT) - 80, IELTS - 6.5, Duolingo - 115, or PTE - 56.
Requirements: A completed graduate application includes an online application form, a statement of purpose, letters of recommendation, and official transcripts from all institutions attended. GRE/GMAT scores are not required for this program. Admission to the M.S. degree program is granted to students who have a bachelor’s degree in electrical and/or computer engineering or a related science or engineering field.
Department: Wallace H. Coulter School of Engineering
Description: The Master of Science in Electrical & Computer Engineering (MSECE) program will give you the knowledge and experience you need to advance in today's fast-paced engineering world. Our program is a natural extension of our highly-regarded undergraduate program. You can earn an MS in ECE through one of two tracks. The professional track is a coursework-only degree. It offers a broad background in electrical and computer engineering. The research track requires a thesis. It offers an opportunity to join the discovery of new knowledge. Whichever track you choose, you'll learn from world-class faculty. They are leaders in their fields, passionate about their work and dedicated to your success. Our graduate programs are small. You will find it easy to collaborate with fellow students and work with faculty members who are accessible and invested in your growth. As a result, you’ll graduate prepared to lead in your field, whether in industry or academia.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Electrical and Computer Engineering, Power Engineering Concentration
DeadlineDate: Applications for the fall semester received by February 15 for master's programs receive priority consideration for financial aid. Applications are accepted after this date on a rolling basis. The deadline for spring semester is October 15 and for summer semester is March 15.
EnglishScore: If your native language is not English, you must submit proof of English proficiency. We accept the following tests and scores: TOEFL (iBT): 80, IELTS: 6.5, PTE: 56, Duolingo: 115. The English proficiency requirement can be waived if you have a degree from an institution in a country where English is the native language (e.g., U.S., U.K., Canada, Australia).
Requirements: A bachelor's degree in a relevant discipline is required. The following are required for an application to be considered complete. Please submit all materials through our online application portal.
Department: Wallace H. Coulter School of Engineering
Description: The Master of Science in Electrical and Computer Engineering is a research-based master's degree program for students with an undergraduate degree in electrical engineering or a closely related field. At Clarkson, we offer research opportunities in power and energy systems, wireless communications, data and complex networks, machine learning, deep learning, signal and image processing, cybersecurity, control systems and robotics. You will work closely with a faculty advisor to design a customized plan of study and research that's right for you. You will also have access to our state-of-the-art labs and research centers. Our program will provide you with the advanced technical skills and research experience you need to launch or advance your career, or to continue on to a PhD program. Students choose between a thesis option and a non-thesis option. The thesis option prepares you for a research and development career or doctoral studies. The non-thesis option is geared toward students who desire a career in advanced engineering development.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Electrical Engineering
EnglishScore: Applicants who are not native English speakers must submit evidence of their English proficiency. Accepted tests and minimum scores are: TOEFL (minimum of 80 Internet-based or 550 paper-based), IELTS (minimum of 6.5), PTE Academic (minimum of 56), Duolingo English Test (minimum of 115), or a certificate of completion of Level 112 from ELS Language Centers. A waiver may be granted for students who have attended a U.S. institution for one year or more, or who have earned a degree from a country on the English Proficiency Waiver List.
Department: Wallace H. Coulter School of Engineering
Description: The Master of Science in Electrical Engineering program will provide you with a high-quality education to prepare you for leadership roles in research, development and design positions that require skillful and imaginative solutions to complex engineering problems. Clarkson’s Department of Electrical & Computer Engineering offers programs that give you an opportunity for advanced study and research in a number of important areas of electrical and computer engineering. Major areas of research include power and energy systems, wireless communications, signal processing, machine learning and controls and robotics. A non-thesis option is available.
ScholarshipType: Teaching Assistantships, Research Assistantships, Partial-Tuition Scholarships

ProgramName: Master of Science in Electrical Engineering for Working Professionals
EnglishScore: Applicants must demonstrate their proficiency in English by submitting an official score report from one of our approved standardized exams: TOEFL, IELTS, PTE, or Duolingo English Test. Our minimum score requirements are as follows: TOEFL (iBT): 80, IELTS: 6.5, PTE: 56, Duolingo English Test: 115.
Department: Wallace H. Coulter School of Engineering
ScholarshipType: Teaching Assistantships, Research Assistantships, Tuition Scholarships

ProgramName: Master of Science in Engineering Management
EnglishScore: For international applicants, official scores from one of the following are required: TOEFL (minimum 80 Internet-based), IELTS (minimum 6.5), PTE Academic (minimum 56), or Duolingo English Test (minimum 115). The requirement can be waived if the applicant has earned a degree from a country where English is the native language or has studied in the U.S. for two or more years.
Department: Wallace H. Coulter School of Engineering
Description: The Master of Science in Engineering Management (MSEM) is an interdisciplinary, customizable graduate degree that bridges the gap between the fields of engineering and business. The MSEM allows you to take courses from both the Wallace H. Coulter School of Engineering and the David D. Reh School of Business. You will learn the business and leadership skills necessary to advance your career in a technical field. You will develop an understanding of management, finance, marketing and data analytics. As the program is customizable, you can focus on the areas that align best with your career goals. This non-thesis program requires 30 credit hours, 15 of which can be transferred in. GRE scores are also waived for all MSEM applicants. The program can be completed fully online, fully in person or a hybrid of the two. Part-time and full-time study options are available. The MSEM degree is a STEM-designated program, making it a great option for international students who wish to work in the U.S. after graduation.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Engineering Science
EnglishScore: Applicants who are not citizens of countries where English is the official language must submit scores from the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), the International English Language Testing System (IELTS), Duolingo or the Pearson Test of English (PTE). Minimum TOEFL score of 80 (Internet-based). Minimum IELTS score of 6.5. Minimum Duolingo score of 115. Minimum PTE score of 56. The English proficiency test is not required for applicants who have completed a degree at an institution where English is the language of instruction and in a country where English is an official language.
Department: Wallace H. Coulter School of Engineering
Description: The Master of Science in Engineering Science (MSES) is a highly flexible, interdisciplinary graduate engineering degree. It is well-suited for students with an undergraduate engineering degree who want to broaden their engineering background or specialize in a particular area not covered by traditional departmental master's programs. Due to the interdisciplinary nature of the program, you can pursue coursework within any of our engineering departments, as well as in the sciences, business and other areas. Your course selection is very flexible and can be customized to suit your needs and interests. With your advisor, you will create an individual plan of study. Some recent examples include biomechanics, structural engineering, environmental engineering, manufacturing, materials, robotics, and fluid mechanics.
ScholarshipAmount: up to $19,000 for the academic year
ScholarshipType: Merit-based scholarships, Teaching Assistantships (TA), Research Assistantships (RA)

ProgramName: Master of Science in Environmental Policy
EnglishScore: If your native language is not English, you must submit proof of English proficiency. Acceptable tests include TOEFL (minimum 80 iBT), IELTS (minimum 6.5), Duolingo (minimum 115), PTE Academic (minimum 56), or successful completion of ELS Language Centers Level 112. The English proficiency requirement may be waived if you have studied for two or more years in a country where English is the native language and you have earned a bachelor's or master's degree from an accredited institution in that country.
Requirements:
To be considered for admission, you will need to submit a graduate application and the following:

A Statement of Purpose: This statement should explain your reasons for wanting to pursue this degree and your research interests.
Your Résumé: Please provide a current copy of your résumé.
Three Letters of Recommendation: These letters should be from individuals who can speak to your academic and professional qualifications.
Official Transcripts: Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended should be sent to the Office of Graduate Admissions.
Standardized Test Scores: The GRE is not required for admission to this program.
Description: The Master of Science in Environmental Policy is a 30-credit-hour program that prepares you for leadership careers in government agencies at all levels, from local to international; nonprofit conservation and environmental organizations; and private sector firms in the growing green economy. You can design a curriculum in collaboration with your advisor that fits your academic interests and career aspirations. You will take core courses in environmental law, economics and research methods while building expertise in an area of your choice through electives and a major research project, professional internship or thesis. In just one year of full-time study, you will gain the scientific knowledge, analytical skills and political and legal understanding you need to become a successful environmental leader.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Environmental Science and Engineering
EnglishScore: Proof of English proficiency is required for all students for whom English is a second language. This can be met by submitting one of the following: TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language): minimum score of 80 on the iBT (internet-based test) or 550 on the pBT (paper-based test); IELTS (International English Language Testing System): minimum score of 6.5; Duolingo English Test: minimum score of 115; Pearson Test of English: minimum score of 56; Successful completion of ELS level 112.
Description: The Master of Science in Environmental Science & Engineering (ESE) program provides a strong foundation in the fundamental principles of science and engineering applicable to the environment. The program prepares students for careers in environmental science and engineering practice with government, industry and consulting firms and for further graduate study. Both thesis and non-thesis options are available. The program is specifically designed to accommodate students with a variety of backgrounds, including individuals with undergraduate degrees in engineering, as well as those with degrees in science or math disciplines such as biology, chemistry, geology, physics and mathematics.
ScholarshipType: Merit-based scholarships, Teaching assistantships (TAs), and Research assistantships (RAs)

ProgramName: Master of Business Administration in Global Supply Chain Management
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must submit a TOEFL, IELTS, PTE, or Duolingo score. Minimum requirements are as follows: TOEFL (IBT): 80, IELTS: 6.5, PTE: 56, Duolingo: 115. Completion of ELS Language Centers Level 112 is also acceptable. The English proficiency testing requirement may be waived for applicants who have completed a degree at an institution where English is the language of instruction.
Requirements: In addition to the general application requirements, applicants must submit the following: A bachelor's degree from an accredited institution. Test Scores: The GMAT/GRE requirement is waived for all MBA applicants with a 3.3 GPA or higher, OR 3.0 GPA or higher AND two or more years of professional work experience. If you do not meet the waiver requirements, your application will be reviewed holistically. Contact us to learn more. Letters of Recommendation: Two letters are required. At least one must be from a faculty member who is familiar with your academic work. The other may be from an employer or another faculty member. If you have significant work experience, two letters of recommendation may be from a professional setting. Resume. Statement of purpose.
Description:
The Clarkson University residential Master of Business Administration in Global Supply Chain Management is a one-year program that prepares students for leadership roles in the global business environment. With Clarkson's MBA, students develop skills in business fundamentals and learn to apply them in an increasingly complex and dynamic global setting. Clarkson's MBA program is nationally ranked by U.S. News & World Report. Students will: 
* Gain knowledge in business foundations, including accounting, finance, marketing and management.
* Acquire in-demand skills in data analytics and decision-making.
* Learn to design and manage sustainable supply chains by understanding the flow of materials, information and capital.
* Have real-world consulting experience as part of our Global Business Program course.

The Clarkson MBA is a STEM-designated degree program.
Accredidation: The David D. Reh School of Business is accredited by the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB), a distinction held by only 5 percent of business schools worldwide.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Healthcare Data Analytics
EnglishScore: For international applicants whose native language is not English, demonstration of English language proficiency is required. This can be done by providing an official score report from TOEFL, IELTS, PTE, or Duolingo, or by providing an official transcript showing a degree earned from an accredited institution in a country where English is the native language or from an accredited U.S. institution. Minimum scores are TOEFL (iBT) 80, IELTS 6.5, PTE 56, and Duolingo 115.
Department: Reh School of Business, Lewis School of Health Sciences, and Wallace H. Coulter School of Engineering
Description: The Master of Science in Healthcare Data Analytics at Clarkson University is an interdisciplinary program for students with an interest in information technology, data analytics and the business of healthcare. Students study data analytics in the context of the healthcare industry and learn how to leverage it to create insights and improve the delivery of care. This degree program prepares students for a career as a data scientist or data analyst in the healthcare sector. The curriculum incorporates courses from data analytics, computer science and the healthcare management MBA program, providing students with the breadth and depth necessary for success.
Accredidation: All programs at Clarkson University are accredited by the Middle States Commission on Higher Education. The program is offered through Clarkson's School of Business, which is accredited by the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB).

ProgramName: Master of Business Administration in Healthcare Management
EnglishScore: For International Applicants: All international applicants must submit TOEFL or IELTS scores. Minimum TOEFL score of 80 and minimum IELTS score of 6.5.
Requirements: A completed online application form. A bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university. Official transcripts from all institutions attended. A current résumé. A statement of purpose. Three letters of recommendation. Standardized test scores (GMAT or GRE). GMAT/GRE waivers are available. International students must meet English proficiency requirements.
Department: David D. Reh School of Business
Description: The Clarkson MBA in Healthcare Management is a specialized master's of business administration degree that gives students the business skills necessary to become a leader in the healthcare field. Our curriculum is based in business fundamentals, such as finance, accounting and marketing, and applies them to the complex U.S. healthcare system. As a student in our program, you will gain skills and experience in healthcare information technology, leadership, policy, financing, data analytics and more. A nine-month paid residency is a hallmark of the program. Through the residency, you will have the opportunity to apply what you've learned in the classroom to a real-world healthcare setting. The residency can be completed anywhere in the U.S. By the time you graduate, you will have made valuable professional connections and built a résumé of work experience, preparing you for success from day one of your career.
Accredidation: The MBA in Healthcare Management is offered by the Reh School of Business, which is accredited by the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB International).

ProgramName: Master of Science in High School Education
EnglishScore: All international students must demonstrate proficiency in English. Clarkson accepts the following tests and scores: TOEFL iBT (and iBT Home Edition) minimum 80, IELTS (and IELTS Indicator) minimum 6.5, PTE Academic minimum 56, Duolingo English Test (DET) minimum 115. An English proficiency test may be waived if the applicant has completed at least 3 years of academic study at a secondary or post-secondary institution where the primary language of instruction is English.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Industrial Management
EnglishScore: For international applicants whose native language is not English, proficiency must be demonstrated with one of the following exams: TOEFL iBT (minimum score of 80), IELTS (minimum score of 6.5), PTE (minimum score of 56), or Duolingo (minimum score of 115). The requirement may be waived for applicants who have received a degree from an institution in a country where English is the native language.
Department: David D. Reh School of Business
Description: The Master of Science in Industrial Management (MSIM) is a STEM-designated, 30-credit-hour graduate program designed for students with a background in engineering, science or other technical fields. In the program, you will develop the quantitative and qualitative skills you need to become a manager and leader at a technology-based organization. This program is ideal for those who want to start their career in management or advance to managerial roles from a technical position. Graduates of the program are well prepared to address a broad range of challenges in areas such as supply chain management, project management, product development, quality management, human resources and strategic planning. The program is flexible and can be customized to fit your professional and personal goals. It is offered online or on campus, and you may enroll on a full-time or part-time basis. You can complete the degree in as little as one year.
Accredidation: The David D. Reh School of Business is accredited by the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB International) in business and accounting.

Description:
The Master of Science (MS) in Mechanical Engineering is a research-focused degree that culminates with a master's thesis based on independent research. The thesis research is conducted under the guidance of a faculty advisor. The MS degree typically takes two years to complete.

The Master of Engineering (ME) in Mechanical Engineering is a project-based degree that requires a report based on a design or research project. The project is often conducted as part of a team and is supervised by a faculty advisor. The ME is a professional degree and typically takes one year to complete.

Both the MS and ME degrees consist of 30 credit hours of coursework and research/project work. Graduates of both programs are prepared to enter industry at an advanced level or to pursue further graduate study.

EnglishScore: All international applicants whose native language is not English are required to provide proof of English language proficiency. Description:
Our Master of Science in Mechanical Engineering program is ideal for working professionals. A thesis is not required, and all courses are available online. Classes are recorded so that they can be viewed at any time. There is no residency requirement. You will also have the option of pursuing a thesis, with approval from the department.

The Master of Science in Mechanical Engineering is a 30-credit-hour program that does not require a thesis. For those who elect the non-thesis option, there are no required courses, so they may select any 10 graduate-level courses that are of interest to them.

For students who wish to pursue the thesis option, six to 10 of their 30 credit hours will be dedicated to research. This requires approval from the department. 

There are two options within the Master of Science in Mechanical Engineering degree program: a thesis option and a non-thesis option. Most students take two courses per semester and finish the program in under two years. With the non-thesis option, you simply must complete the required 30 credit hours. Those who elect to write a thesis will work with an advisor to identify a research topic. You will then write a formal thesis and give a final defense. Our graduate students are also encouraged to participate in research opportunities.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Occupational Therapy
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must submit scores for the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), the International English Language Testing System (IELTS), or the Duolingo English Test. The minimum acceptable scores are: TOEFL: 80, IELTS: 6.5, Duolingo: 115. Applicants holding a bachelor's or master's degree from an accredited institution in the U.S., U.K., or Canada are exempt from the English proficiency requirement.
Requirements:
The Clarkson University Department of Occupational Therapy participates in the Occupational Therapy Centralized Application Service, known as OTCAS. Applicants will apply online using the OTCAS application.

Prerequisite Courses
The following prerequisite courses must have been completed within the last ten years with a grade of C or better:
* Biology with lab (4 credits)
* Human Anatomy & Physiology I & II with labs (8 credits)
* General Psychology (3 credits)
* Abnormal Psychology (3 credits)
* Lifespan Development (or developmental psychology) (3 credits)
* Sociology or Anthropology (3 credits)
* Statistics (3 credits)
* Medical Terminology (1 credit or certificate of completion)

Admission Requirements
* Baccalaureate degree from an accredited institution.
* A minimum overall GPA of 3.2 is required. For applicants with multiple degrees, GPAs will be averaged to calculate the overall GPA. The GPA for prerequisite courses must also be 3.2 or above.
* Three letters of reference.
* The GRE is not required for admission to the OT program.
* A personal statement is required.
* TOEFL or IELTS scores for international applicants whose native language is not English.
* Observation/experience in at least two different OT settings is required. A total of 40 hours of observation/experience are required.
* Successful completion of a personal interview with OT faculty.
Description:
Clarkson's Master of Science in Occupational Therapy (MSOT) is a comprehensive, full-time, graduate-level program that prepares you for entry-level practice as an occupational therapist. Our program has a strong focus on interprofessional collaboration and evidence-based practice and a mission to address the unique occupational needs of rural populations. Through a mixture of classroom learning, hands-on labs, research and fieldwork, you will learn to provide quality, evidence-based care to people of all ages and abilities. Our dynamic curriculum is infused with threads of interprofessional collaboration and rural healthcare. You will learn to:
- Articulate and apply occupational therapy theory, models of practice and frames of reference.
- Demonstrate an understanding of the occupational therapy process.
- Demonstrate clinical reasoning to develop and implement occupation-centered intervention plans.
- Articulate the role of the occupational therapist in a variety of settings.
- Locate, critique and apply evidence to inform practice.
- Articulate and apply the AOTA Code of Ethics and Standards of Practice.
Accredidation: The entry-level occupational therapy master’s degree program has applied for accreditation and has been granted the status of Candidacy Status by the Accreditation Council for Occupational Therapy Education (ACOTE) of the American Occupational Therapy Association (AOTA), located at 6116 Executive Boulevard, Suite 200, North Bethesda, MD 20852-4929. ACOTE’s telephone number c/o AOTA is (301) 652-AOTA and its Web address is www.acoteonline.org.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Physician Assistant Studies
EnglishScore: All international applicants must demonstrate proficiency in the English language. Applicants must submit one of the following: TOEFL (minimum 80 iBT), IELTS (minimum 6.5), PTE (minimum 56) or Duolingo (minimum 115).
Description: The Clarkson University Master of Science in Physician Assistant (PA) Studies program is a 28-month course of study that prepares students for careers as healthcare providers. Graduates of our PA program will be compassionate, culturally competent PAs with strong interpersonal and communication skills who can provide excellent care to patients as part of a healthcare team. Students begin the program in Potsdam with 16 months of classroom study, during which they will learn the fundamentals of medical science and clinical reasoning. Didactic coursework includes anatomy, physiology, pharmacology, physical diagnosis, clinical medicine, evidence-based medicine and medical ethics, among others. While in Potsdam, our students hone their skills in a state-of-the-art clinical skills lab that includes exam rooms, high-fidelity human simulators, a hospital suite and a procedural skills training area. Students then move on to the clinical phase of their education, completing 12 months of supervised clinical practice experiences (SCPEs) with a focus on serving rural and underserved populations in upstate New York. Students are required to complete nine rotations during their clinical year, including family medicine, internal medicine, pediatrics, prenatal and gynecologic care, behavioral and mental health care, general surgery and emergency medicine. Our graduates are highly sought after by employers and are eligible for licensure in all 50 states after passing the Physician Assistant National Certifying Exam (PANCE).
Accredidation: The ARC-PA has granted Accreditation-Continued status to the Clarkson University Physician Assistant Program sponsored by Clarkson University. Accreditation-Continued is an accreditation status granted when a currently accredited program is in compliance with the ARC-PA Standards. Accreditation remains in effect until the program closes or withdraws from the accreditation process or until accreditation is withdrawn for failure to comply with the Standards. The approximate date for the next validation review of the program by the ARC-PA will be March 2029. The review date is contingent upon continued compliance with the Accreditation Standards and ARC-PA policy.
ScholarshipType: Merit-based, HRSA Scholarships for Disadvantaged Students, National Health Service Corps Scholarship, Veterans Affairs Scholarships

It is designed to be completed in one or two years. The program prepares students for Ph.D. programs or for research and technical jobs in industry. Students also get to experience Clarkson's strong research program in fundamental and applied physics. The Master of Science in Physics at Clarkson will give you a comprehensive understanding of core subjects. You will be exposed to specialized areas of physics research, such as complex systems, biophysics, condensed matter physics and relativity. As a student in the program, you will develop a deep and practical understanding of physics principles, as well as an ability to conduct independent research.

The graduate program in chemical engineering at Clarkson is an internationally recognized program offering master's and PhD degrees. The program provides a broad fundamental background in chemical engineering, along with advanced study in specialized areas. We prepare chemical engineers to successfully pursue careers in a wide range of fields, including industrial research and development, manufacturing, and academic teaching and research.

Our faculty are known for being approachable and supportive of our students' intellectual curiosity and desire to learn. Graduate students work closely with their advisors, and many projects are interdisciplinary, providing opportunities to work with faculty and graduate students from other departments and research centers on campus.

Our program is big enough to support a robust and thriving intellectual atmosphere yet small enough for students to receive a high degree of personal attention. Students participate in a weekly departmental seminar series, featuring speakers from leading academic and industrial research groups around the world. These seminars give you valuable opportunities to enhance your understanding of the latest developments in research and foster professional networking.

Most of our Ph.D. students receive some form of financial support, including tuition waivers and stipends for living expenses. In return, you will be expected to conduct publishable research with your advisor and serve as a teaching or research assistant. For most students, a Ph.D. in civil and environmental engineering takes four years to complete after a bachelor of science degree and two to three years of study after a master of science degree.

All admitted PhD students receive four years of financial support in the form of a teaching or research assistantship, which includes a stipend and tuition waiver. This support is based on a student's satisfactory progress toward their degree. Admission to the PhD program is highly competitive.

You can also work directly with prominent research centers, such as the Center for Advanced Materials Processing (CAMP), the Center for Identification Technology Research (CITeR) and the Institute for a Sustainable Environment (ISE). In addition, six graduate-level courses beyond the MS degree are required. Students can receive financial support through research and teaching assistantships, as well as fellowships and tuition scholarships.

The Engineering Science (ES) PhD program is a cross-disciplinary program designed to give you maximum flexibility to pursue research that crosses traditional departmental boundaries. The program allows for a plan of study that complements your specific research interests and provides depth in one particular subject while offering a broad understanding of related subjects.

As a student, you will work closely with a faculty advisor to select courses and define a research topic that aligns with your personal interests and future career goals. The goal of the program is to produce PhD graduates who are independent researchers capable of performing high-level research in academic or industrial settings.

Our students are deeply committed to making the world a better place by creating solutions to environmental problems like water and air pollution, contaminated lands and climate change. As a student in this program, you will expand your breadth of knowledge across disciplines and acquire in-depth skills in a specific area of interest. You will conduct innovative, original research and publish your findings in peer-reviewed journals. You will also participate in conferences, submit grant proposals and develop your professional network. You will graduate ready to take on a leadership role in environmental science and engineering.

Description: The Doctor of Philosophy (PhD) in Materials Science and Engineering is an interdisciplinary program providing students a doctoral-level education in the science and engineering of materials. As a student, you will investigate how the structure of a material on an atomic and microscopic level relates to its macroscopic properties, including its mechanical, electrical, thermal and optical behaviors. At Clarkson, you will gain an understanding of structure-property relationships in different classes of materials, including ceramics, composites, electronic materials, glasses, metals, polymers and semiconductors. You will also develop expertise in applying this understanding to engineer better and more useful materials.
ScholarshipAmount: The current stipend for qualified doctoral candidates is $30,000 for 12 months. Doctoral students who are awarded a research or teaching assistantship are also awarded a tuition scholarship that covers up to 30 credits hours of tuition per academic year.

Description: Clarkson’s Doctor of Physical Therapy (DPT) program prepares you for a rewarding career as a physical therapist. We're an established leader in the field and one of the oldest physical therapy schools in the nation. Our expert faculty will prepare you to be an autonomous, evidence-informed physical therapy practitioner. As a Clarkson DPT student, you will learn to apply principles of patient-centered care. You'll work with patients from diverse backgrounds as a part of an interprofessional healthcare team. This is a comprehensive, three-year, full-time program. You can also specialize in a particular area of physical therapy. There are three optional concentrations to choose from: education, research and sports physical therapy.
Accredidation: The Doctor of Physical Therapy Program at Clarkson University is accredited by the Commission on Accreditation in Physical Therapy Education (CAPTE), 3030 Potomac Ave., Suite 100, Alexandria, Virginia 22305-3085; telephone: 703-706-3245; email: accreditation@apta.org; website: http://www.capteonline.org.

ProgramName: Advanced Certificate in Business
Requirements: Students can apply for graduate credit and complete one of our Advanced Business Certificates using the standard graduate business application. A GMAT or GRE is not required for the Advanced Business Certificates. General application requirements for graduate programs include: Online Application and Fee, Statement of Purpose, Resume or CV, Letters of Recommendation, and Official Transcripts.
Department: David D. Reh School of Business
Description: The Advanced Certificate in Business is a 15-credit-hour program offered through the Reh School of Business. It provides a foundation of business knowledge for individuals who may not have an undergraduate degree in business. This includes students currently enrolled in a Clarkson graduate program, as well as working professionals who want to strengthen their knowledge of core business principles to enhance their career.
Accredidation: The David D. Reh School of Business is accredited by the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB). Fewer than five percent of business schools worldwide have this distinction.

ProgramName: Advanced Certificate in Business of Energy
Requirements: All applicants must submit the following: an online application and application fee, a current resume, a statement of purpose, official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended, and letters of recommendation. Clarkson has waived the GMAT/GRE requirement for most graduate programs.
Department: David D. Reh School of Business
Description: The energy industry is rapidly changing, driven by technological innovations and new business models focused on sustainable, reliable and affordable energy. In the Advanced Certificate in Business of Energy program at Clarkson University, you can sharpen your business acumen and broaden your understanding of the evolving energy landscape. In just nine months, our online program prepares you for leadership roles in a variety of fields that intersect with energy, including business, policy and engineering. No matter your undergraduate background, you will gain the skills you need to become a successful energy professional. In our 12-credit certificate program, you'll gain the foundational knowledge of how the energy industry works, from production to delivery. Through an interdisciplinary curriculum and close interactions with our world-class faculty, you'll acquire expertise in financial management, energy systems and technology, and the industry's environmental and social impact.
Accredidation: The David D. Reh School of Business is accredited by the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB International), a seal of excellence earned by fewer than five percent of business schools worldwide.

ProgramName: Advanced Certificate in Business Fundamentals
EnglishScore: For international applicants, an English proficiency test may be required. Accepted tests include TOEFL (80 iBT/550 PBT), IELTS (6.5), Duolingo (115), PTE Academic (56), or ELS Level 112.
Requirements: A completed online application form. A bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution. Transcripts of all previous college coursework. Two letters of recommendation. A resume or curriculum vitae. A statement of purpose.
Department: David D. Reh School of Business
Description: As the economy and workforce in New York’s Capital Region continue to grow, the demand for business leaders has increased. Our 15-credit Advanced Certificate in Business Fundamentals is ideal for anyone looking to make a career change or take on a leadership role in their organization. This certificate will provide the business principles and critical skills that employers demand. It can be completed in as little as nine months and all courses are offered in the evenings to meet the scheduling needs of working professionals. All credits earned can be seamlessly applied to our MBA program if you later decide to pursue a graduate degree.

ProgramName: Advanced Certificate in Construction Engineering Management
EnglishScore: International Applicants are required to submit TOEFL or IELTS scores.
Department: Wallace H. Coulter School of Engineering
Description: The Advanced Certificate in Construction Engineering Management is a 15-credit-hour graduate-level program that will provide you with the fundamental management principles and sophisticated construction engineering techniques required to lead major infrastructure projects. You will learn construction industry practices, legal aspects of engineering and advanced construction engineering methods. Upon completion, you will have the knowledge and expertise needed to manage the schedule, cost, quality, safety, scope and function of a project from start to finish. You will be prepared for a career in consulting, design, construction and management of public and private facilities. This certificate is ideal for civil and environmental engineering students who are enrolled in the Master of Science or Master of Engineering programs, as well as for working professionals in the civil engineering and construction industries who wish to expand their expertise or shift career paths. All courses are delivered by faculty with extensive professional experience and are available in both on-campus and online formats.

ProgramName: Advanced Certificate in Environmental Management
EnglishScore: All international applicants must submit proof of English language proficiency. You can do so by submitting one of the following: TOEFL: score of 80; IELTS: score of 6.5; PTE: score of 56; Duolingo: score of 115. Applicants are exempt from this requirement if they have a degree from a U.S. institution or a degree from an institution in a country where English is the official language (e.g., U.K., Australia, etc.).
Description: A highly complex field, environmental management requires an equally multi-faceted educational background. Our program helps you meet that need by giving you a foundation in environmental science, engineering, law, policy and management. We place an emphasis on developing your quantitative, analytical and communication skills, so you'll be well-prepared to identify, analyze and manage a wide range of complex environmental problems.
Accredidation: All certificate programs are registered with the New York State Education Department and offered through our AACSB-accredited Reh School of Business.

ProgramName: Advanced Certificate in Healthcare Management
EnglishScore: All international applicants, regardless of country of citizenship, must demonstrate a strong proficiency in the English language to be admitted to Clarkson. Applicants who have completed a degree at an institution in a country where English is the official language, such as the United States, Canada (except Quebec), the United Kingdom, Ireland, Australia, or New Zealand, are not required to submit an English proficiency test score. All other international applicants must submit an official score from one of the following exams, taken within the last two years: TOEFL iBT, IELTS, PTE Academic, or Duolingo English Test. We also accept ELS Level 112 with a grade of B or higher.
Requirements: Applicants must have a bachelor’s degree with a minimum 3.0 GPA. Those with at least a 2.75 GPA may be considered for conditional admission. The GRE and GMAT are NOT required. A complete application consists of: Online Application, Transcripts, Resume/CV, Statement of Purpose, Two Letters of Recommendation, TOEFL/IELTS/Duolingo scores (for international students).
Department: David D. Reh School of Business
Description: The advanced certificate in healthcare management is a 15-credit-hour program offered completely online. The program is ideal for professionals currently working in healthcare settings who want to advance their career or those in other fields who want to pivot to the healthcare industry. Courses in this program can be stacked and applied to our MBA in Healthcare Management program. Students will complete five courses with a variety of electives to choose from so they can tailor the program to their individual career goals. Elective topics may include: U.S. Healthcare System & Policy, Healthcare Information Systems, Corporate Finance, Healthcare Operations, and Healthcare Accounting.

ProgramName: Advanced Certificate in Human Resource Management
Description: The role of the human resource (HR) manager has evolved to that of a strategic partner with an organization's top management. This places a premium on managers who are not only knowledgeable in the functional areas of HR but also possess the business acumen to fully contribute to the success of the organization. The Advanced Certificate in Human Resource Management program prepares graduates for this dual role. Students gain deep knowledge of HR from both a strategic and operational perspective. Courses cover core HR skills, including talent acquisition and development, compensation, law, negotiation, and change management. Students can take the certificate as a stand-alone program or combine it with an MBA from Clarkson. Completed on a part-time basis and 100-percent online, the certificate requires 12 credits (four courses).
Accredidation: Our David D. Reh School of Business is accredited by the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB).

ProgramName: Advanced Certificate in Innovation & New Venture Management
EnglishScore: For international students, proof of English language proficiency is required. The university accepts a TOEFL iBT score of 80 (with no subscore below 20), an IELTS score of 6.5 (with no subscore below 6.0), a PTE score of 56, a Duolingo score of 115, or completion of ELS Level 112. Applicants may be exempt if they have a degree from an institution where English was the language of instruction.
Requirements: Online Application, Official Transcripts, One Letter of Recommendation, GMAT/GRE Optional, Statement of Purpose, Resume.
Department: David D. Reh School of Business
Description:
Whether you're looking to launch a business, enter a new industry or take on a greater leadership role at your current organization, the Advanced Certificate in Innovation & New Venture Management from Clarkson University’s David D. Reh School of Business can help you reach your goals.

This nine-credit, fully online certificate program offers you a flexible pathway to gain the business knowledge you need to become a manager and innovator. All credits earned in the program can be applied to our online MBA, which can be completed with an additional 33 credits. It can also be taken by students already enrolled in another graduate program at Clarkson.

Our expert faculty will guide you as you learn how to identify and develop new business ideas and use innovative strategies to lead new and existing ventures. You will master effective approaches for creating, developing and capitalizing on innovation in both startup and corporate environments.

ProgramName: Advanced Certificate in Management & Leadership
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English are required to take the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), the International English Language Testing System (IELTS), Pearson Test of English (PTE) or the Duolingo English Test. This requirement is waived for applicants who have a four-year degree from a U.S. college or university, or from a pre-approved list of English-speaking countries.
Requirements: Ready to apply? You can complete an online application. You'll need to submit the following: Online Application Form, Current Résumé, Statement of Purpose, Official Transcripts, Two Letters of Recommendation.
Department: David D. Reh School of Business
Description: The Advanced Certificate in Management & Leadership at Clarkson University provides a path for aspiring leaders to develop the necessary management skills for today's ever-changing business world. The program is designed for working professionals who wish to complement their primary areas of expertise with core business skills. Participants of this program will gain a solid foundation in the fundamental areas of business and management. This certificate provides individuals with a framework for understanding and integrating key business functions. This certificate program is designed for individuals with or without a business background who have completed a bachelor's degree in any discipline. Those who wish to advance into management roles in their career can benefit greatly from this certificate. Individuals looking to improve their current job performance by gaining business knowledge and skills are also strong candidates for this program. Students will learn core skills in management, leadership, marketing, finance, accounting, and information systems. After completing the program, you will have developed the skills necessary to lead teams and projects, understand basic financial and accounting principles, apply marketing strategies, and use information systems to make informed business decisions. This program offers a flexible curriculum, allowing you to choose courses that align with your career goals and interests. You will have the opportunity to learn from experienced faculty who are experts in their fields and network with other professionals in your cohort.

ProgramName: Advanced Certificate in Power Systems Engineering
EnglishScore: International students must demonstrate English language proficiency. We do not have a minimum test score for admission, but we do look for general proficiency. If you are a non-native English speaker, please submit ONE of the following: TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language), IELTS (International English Language Testing System), PTE (Pearson Test of English), Duolingo English Test. You may be exempt from this requirement if you have studied in the United States for two or more years and have earned a bachelor’s or master’s degree from a U.S. institution or if you are from an English-speaking country.
Requirements: A complete application consists of the following: Online Application Form; Statement of Purpose; Résumé; Three Letters of Recommendation; Official Transcripts. GRE General Test is recommended but not required. International Applicants: an official TOEFL or IELTS score is required.
Department: Wallace H. Coulter School of Engineering
Description: The Advanced Certificate in Power Systems Engineering provides an opportunity for working professionals to obtain specialization in the area of power systems and enhance their knowledge and skills in power engineering. It also allows individuals to explore their interests in power systems engineering before formally committing to a master’s program. The certificate consists of 9 credits of graduate-level coursework (three courses). Course credits can be transferred into a full master’s degree program.

ProgramName: Advanced Certificate in Supply Chain Management
EnglishScore: For international applicants, an English proficiency test is required. We accept the TOEFL, IELTS and Duolingo.
Description: Supply chains are the engine for every business — and they need smart, capable leaders to power them. The online graduate certificate in Global Supply Chain Management at Clarkson University provides a world-class foundational understanding of supply chain management principles for leaders at all levels. Developed and taught by faculty from Clarkson's top-ranked supply chain MBA program, this certificate can be completed in as little as nine months and consists of four online, seven-week courses. This certificate can also serve as a pathway toward Clarkson's top-ranked online MBA program. In our graduate certificate in supply chain management program, you will gain a deep understanding of core supply chain functions and learn to improve the overall operational performance of a business enterprise. You will learn to use cutting-edge decision tools to implement solutions to supply chain problems in real time. Our project-based, experiential learning curriculum also allows you to focus on specific problems in your industry.
Accredidation: Our Reh School of Business is accredited by the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB), a distinction that only 5 percent of business schools worldwide can claim.

ProgramName: Advanced Certificate in Accounting
EnglishScore: International students whose native language is not English are required to submit proof of English proficiency. This can be met by providing scores from the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), Pearson Test of English Academic (PTE) or Duolingo English Test. An applicant may be exempt from this requirement if they have received a degree from a university in a country where English is the native language (e.g., USA, Canada, UK, Ireland, Australia, New Zealand).
Requirements: All graduate applicants are required to submit the following: Online Application and Fee; Official Transcripts; Letters of Recommendation (usually two, but varies by program); Standardized Test Scores (GRE or GMAT - varies by program, some programs have waived this requirement); Resume or Curriculum Vitae (CV); Statement of Purpose; English Proficiency Test Scores (for international students).
Description: The Advanced Certificate in Accounting is a 15-credit-hour program offered through the David D. Reh School of Business. It is designed to help students meet the educational requirements for CPA licensure in New York State. The coursework can be taken as part of a residential MBA program or on a non-matriculated basis. You can customize the program by choosing five courses from a variety of accounting subjects based on your individual needs and interests. The Reh School of Business is accredited by the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB International). Less than 5 percent of the more than 16,000 business schools worldwide have earned this distinction. This accreditation signifies that the Reh School has met the highest standards in business education and is committed to continuous improvement.
Accredidation: The Reh School of Business is accredited by the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB International).
